Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • Matrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class contains the necessary functionality for working with matrices and solving matrix-related problems.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Matrix(double[][] matrix)
      Accepts an existing 2D array and converts it to the matrix type.
      Matrix(int rows, int columns)
      Initializes an empty 2D array with the form Rows x Columns.
      Matrix(java.lang.String filePath)
      Reads a matrix in from a text file.

        A matrix operation that swaps the specified rows of this matrix.
        Parameters:
        row1 - The first row to swap.
        row2 - The second row to swap.

      • rowMultiply

        public void rowMultiply(int row,
                        double scalar)
        Multiply a row in this matrix by the scalar quantity.
        Parameters:
        row - The row that is to be scaled.
        scalar - The quantity by which to scale the row.

      • rowMultiplyAndAdd

        public void rowMultiplyAndAdd(int row1,
                              int row2,
                              double scalar)
        A matrix row operation that consists of multiplying row2 by the scalar (nondestructively) and then adding the result to row1.
        Parameters:
        row1 - The row that is to be modified.
        row2 - The row whose values are to be scaled and added to row1.
        scalar - The amount by which to scale row 2.

      • transpose

        public Matrix transpose()
        Transpose the matrix. Coordinates become flipped so (1, 2) goes to (2, 1), (1, 3) goes to (3, 1) etc. The resulting matrix goes from 'AxB' to 'BxA'.
        Returns:
        A new matrix containing the transposed values.

      • clone

        public Matrix clone()
        Create a copy of this matrix in a new matrix object.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A duplicate of this matrix.

      • mult

        public Matrix mult(Matrix other)
        Multiply this matrix by another matrix. This operation is NOT commutative.
        Parameters:
        other - The other matrix by which to multiply this matrix.
        Returns:
        A new matrix containing the multiplied values.

      • isSquare

        public boolean isSquare()
        Return 'true' if the matrix is square. 'false' otherwise.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • gaussJordanElimination

        public Matrix gaussJordanElimination()
        Employ the Gauss-Jordan Elimination algorithm for reducing a matrix to a partitioned identity matrix.
        Returns:
        The reduced matrix if possible.

      • inverse

        public Matrix inverse()
        Returns the inverse matrix of this matrix using Gauss-Jordan elimination.
        Returns:
        A new matrix containing the inverse of this matrix.

      • gaussianElimination

        public Matrix gaussianElimination(boolean returnR)
        Employs the Gaussian Elimination algorithm to reduce a matrix.
        Parameters:
        returnR - Return the reduced matrix with the lower lefthand cell set to the R value of the matrix. This can then be used to calculate the determinant of the matrix.
        Returns:
        An upper-triangular reduced matrix if possible.

      • backSubstitute

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> backSubstitute()
        Uses back substitution to get the solutions to a system of equations from a Gaussian Elimination reduced matrix. This operation will succeed without throwing and error even if the matrix has not been properly reduced, however, the solution will not be the correct answer to the system of equations. It only makes sense to call this method on an upper-triangular Ax(A+1) matrix.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the solutions in reverse order.

      • determinant

        public double determinant()
        Returns the determinant of the matrix using Gaussian Elimination.
        Returns:
        The determinant of the matrix.

      • conditionNumber

        public double conditionNumber()
        Returns the condition number of the matrix.
        Returns:
        The condition number of the matrix.

      • prettyPrint

        public void prettyPrint()
        A way to print out the matrix assuming that the values near zero are simply zero.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generate a string representing the matrix.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of the matrix.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Matrix other)
        Checks each value of each cell and compares it against the values from another matrix.
        Parameters:
        other - The matrix to test values against.
        Returns:
        True if the matrices are equal, otherwise false.
